title: Is it true that John from the Book of Revelation is not the same John from The Book of John nor John the Baptist? - Quora

response.answer_text: The author of Revelation was certainly not John the Baptist, who died in 44AD, while the earliest date for the writing of Revelation is around 69AD. As to whether John the Apostle wrote the Gospel, or Revelation, or both : this has been in dispute among scholars for a very long time, and no agreement is likely. Indeed, some scholars claim that the two books were by different authors, neither of whom was the Apostle, and things are further confused when you add in the authorship of the three Epistles of John. Since agreement is impossible, each reader must make up his own mind. My own belief is that the Apostle wrote all three books.

We know that the author of the Book of Revelation is not John the Baptist. John the Baptist was beheaded when Jesus was still alive. Revelation was written decades later. Some say that the author of Revelation could not have been John the Revelator/Beloved. However, that is who the author identifies himself to be.
